column1: - Burning in mouth and throat - Diarrhea - Nausea and vomiting - Slurred speech - Swelling of mouth and tongue - Teary eyes Blistering and swelling in the mouth may be severe enough to prevent normal speaking and swallowing.
Do NOT give milk if the person is having symptoms (such as vomiting, convulsions, or a decreased level of alertness) that make it hard to swallow.
